alert.note: Alert for Mercer (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:13AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Iowa...Illinois... Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Mercer and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Clinton, Jo Daviess, Jackson and Carroll Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at New Boston LD17. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to 18.5 feet Wednesday morning. Additional rises are expected through the end of April. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The next statement will be issued this evening.
